solution.text:
It is given that \(\bigtriangleup \)ABC ~ \(\bigtriangleup \)PQR
\(\Rightarrow \frac {area(ABC)}{area(PQR)}= [\frac {AB}{PQ}]^2=[\frac {AC}{PR}]^2\)
given that area(ABC)=area(PQR)\(\Rightarrow \frac {area(ABC)}{area(PQR)}=1\)
\(\Rightarrow \frac {AB}{PQ}=\frac {AC}{PR}= \sqrt 1 \Rightarrow AB=PQ\,,\,AC=PR\)
Now in \(\bigtriangleup \)ABC and \(\bigtriangleup \)PQR, we have
\(\bigtriangleup \)ABC ~ \(\bigtriangleup \)PQR , AB=PQ and AC=PR
\(\Rightarrow \bigtriangleup ABC \cong \bigtriangleup PQR \)
As area of a triangle = \(\frac 12 \times base \times height\)
\(\Rightarrow \frac 12 \times BC \times AD=_{{j*k}}_\)
\(\Rightarrow AD=_{{2*k}}_\)
\(\Rightarrow PS=_{{2*k}}_\) as \(\bigtriangleup ABC \cong \bigtriangleup PQR \)
